record.dc:title: 274GP22, 15GP22, Greenup County, Kentucky. Hardin Village. Pits, 248, 252.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Fort Ancient Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Pit 252, concave, in left background; Compound Pit 248 in center. Taken from SW. Feature 248: Group of post holes, forming southeast (magn.) corner of House "O", connected by shallow excavations, as shown. Filled with soft dark dirt. Note: This region thoroughly excavated by a ground mole, so photo will show holes not appearing on diagram. Feature 252: Concave pit, sides curving evenly, filled with ash, some dirt admixture in top and bottom. May have been fire pit, but no reddening discernible.
record.wpa:comments: More information about Features, including diagrams, available at institution.
